page.title: 13Miner's Strike In Edlington.
page.content: Many dads are at Edlington Yorkshire Main.In March 1984 a strike broke out which affected the quality of home life by lack of money to buy food, clothes or coal.It was an event which caused a lot of unpleasantness.The men who went down the pit during the strike were classed as SCABS.Families lived on Social Security and Family Allowance.During the long miners strike Mrs.Law provided welfare for the striking miner's families by running a soup kitchen.On Mondays she went to Leeds to buy food for the miners.On Tuesdays,Wednesdays and Fridays 5 women and her huband set the tables for the miners free lunch. One of our father's had a nasty accident at work in 1980.He had three years off work and both knee cartiledges removed.In August 1984 he received compensation.
